result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert E Velez was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court must receive notice of completion prior to 10-02-2020.  Failure to pay or completed Community Service the Court Orders 10 Days Huber as contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.
Blood Test Reimbursement:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Mukwonago Township Police Department.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Last 70 days STAYED.
Credit For Time Served 60 Days.

Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel on November 19, 2014.  Defendant to be released from custody to attend.

AODA Assessment and follow through.

Count #3 was Dismissed.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert E Velez in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed and read in.  Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.   

The Court Orders the Following:

150 days Huber, LAST 70 days Stayed  (Credit - 60 days ).   STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS. 

DAY REPORT CENTER:  60 days, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 70 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed.


FINE:  $1494.00  
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Mukwonago Township  Police Department.
(To be paid at the rate of $25.00  per month commencing 1-2-15 and/or 173 hours of community service.  Court must receive notice of completion prior to due date.  Failure to pay or complete community service the Court orders 10 days Huber as contempt for non-compliance with Court Order).

DL REVOCATION:  24  months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK:  24 months.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel on: November 19, 2014  (defendant to be released from custody to attend)

Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through
filed by the State
